questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation: A previous iteration of the team took part a few years ago, but I am failing to find a link to the page with the move to buildbox

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: We bring digital primitives to real world villages & coliving spaces.  Our legal documents are open source and have inspired many other land based projects to replicate our model.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation: It enables a practical use of web3 for decentralizing access to real estate. It also incentivizes for creating more web3 governed commons in the real world

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: We intend to bring to life the next generation of our protocol (Proof of Presence 2.0) which will move us from the prototyping phase to the scaling phase.

questions.query: For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]—for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

data.title: Onboard new villages onto Closer
data.description: As part of our objectives for our Gitcoin grant was to work on onboarding new customers to Closer.

data.title: Implementing Monerium integration
data.description:
This enables Closer villages to now offer a simple bank transfer option to pay for tokens. 

Alongside a financed token sale offering - where members can pay for their citizenship as a subscription over 3 years - and alongside with our new affiliate functionality, we hope this will enable us to onramp the next wave of customers into the world of tokenized real world assets.

data.reason: This feature is now completed, and we are waiting for OASA Association to be registered in order to start accepting payments with bank transfers for sale of $TDF tokens - unlocking regenerative real world assets on chain.

questions.query: Telegram Handle We Can Use To Contact You
Link to your Public Group Chat
Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: Onboarding physical spaces that serve as meeting points for web3 aficionados, as a place to onramp new web3 participants and bring education about digital sovereignty.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation: We enable a user friend front end to allow physical spaces to distribute access & governance rights to a community of members.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: We are building further web3 primitives, and onboarding more ecovillages to use our stack. We aim to create an integration to inverter.network in order to make our stack even more scalable.

data.title: Proof of Impact
data.description: I am applying to participate in the Proof of Impact

milestones.title: Onboard 50+ users to $presence governance
milestones.description: We are creating new tools for land based projects to issue governance rights. Our primary one is $Presence - which is a decaying soulbound token representing a user's presence in a physical location. The assumption is as global citizen - what should grant governance rights is not just arbitrary citizenship (binary), but rather contextual presence. For example - if you spend 1/3 of your life amongst 3 towns - our assumption is you should be able to have 1/3 governance right in each rather than having to arbitrarily select 1.
